intro: Pedicularis anaticeps, commonly known as the horned monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange, often resembling the shape of a monkey's face. It typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
